title: feat(cron): add threadId to delivery config for threaded channel output
body:
## Summary Add optional `threadId` field to `CronDelivery` so isolated cron jobs can thread their delivery output under an existing message (e.g. Slack `thread_ts`, Discord thread id). ## Problem When cron jobs deliver results to Slack channels, each delivery creates a new top-level message. There's no way to thread cron outputs under a specific message, resulting in a messy channel experience where each job run spawns a disconnected message. ## Solution The delivery pipeline already supported `threadId` end-to-end through `resolveSessionDeliveryTarget()` and `deliverOutboundPayloads()`. This change connects the last mile from the cron job config to the delivery pipeline. ### Changes | File | Change | |------|--------| | `src/cron/types.ts` | Add `threadId?: string` to `CronDelivery` | | `src/cron/delivery.ts` | Extract `threadId` in `resolveCronDeliveryPlan()` | | `src/cron/isolated-agent/run.ts` | Pass `threadId` to delivery target resolver | | `src/cron/isolated-agent/delivery-target.ts` | Accept `threadId`, pass as `explicitThreadId` | | `src/cron/service/jobs.ts` | Merge `threadId` in `mergeCronDelivery()` | | `src/gateway/protocol/schema/cron.ts` | Expose `threadId` in delivery schema | | `src/agents/tools/cron-tool.ts` | Document `threadId` in tool description | ### Usage ```json { "delivery": { "mode": "announce", "channel": "slack", "to": "channel:C0ADV5CPQCR", "threadId": "1770389366.273859" } } ``` ### Future: Auto-threading A nice follow-up would be a `threadMode: "auto"` option where the first delivery creates a new message, captures its ID, and subsequent deliveries thread under it. That's more complex (requires storing state) but would be the ideal UX for recurring reports. ## Testing - All 58 cron tests pass - All 92 outbound delivery tests pass - No TypeScript errors introduced

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

- Adds optional `threadId` to cron delivery configuration so isolated cron runs can thread outbound announcements under an existing message (e.g., Slack thread_ts). - Plumbs `threadId` from cron job config through delivery planning (`resolveCronDeliveryPlan`) into isolated-agent delivery target resolution and outbound delivery. - Updates gateway protocol schemas to expose `threadId` on `CronDelivery` / `CronDeliveryPatch` and documents the new field in the Cron tool description.

Confidence Score: 4/5

- This PR is mostly safe to merge, but there’s a functional gap around legacy/payload-based delivery configuration for thread IDs. - The change is a straightforward plumbing of an optional field through cron delivery and gateway schemas, with minimal surface area. However, `threadId` is only read from `job.delivery`, so jobs/clients using the payload/legacy delivery path won’t be able to thread announcements, which is a behavior mismatch worth fixing before merge. - src/cron/delivery.ts
